chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase L Larocque was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
While incarcerated inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations per DOC policy.
Concurrent with: 21CF449

superMiscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact victim, residence, family or place of employment.

No contact with anyone under age 18 without agent approval.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry and treatment.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF449

Condition added that defendant must reside at parent's residence and he must not leave the residence.

11:33 AM Defendant Chase L Larocque in court with attorney .  Defendant Chase L Larocque in custody.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Detective Leu-Martinek is sworn and questioned by Attorney Zima. Testifies to speaking with an individual named as a potential victim of sexual assault.  Testifies to the allegations made by victim.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Cross-examination by Attorney Smead.  Questions witness regarding the specifics of the allegations.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
